content:
InvokeWorkflowActivity Class

Definition

Asynchronously runs one workflow from another. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("Invoking")]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityToolboxItem))]
[System.Drawing.ToolboxBitmap(typeof(System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity), "Resources.Service.bmp")]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
[System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ActivityValidator(typeof(System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowValidator))]
public sealed class InvokeWorkflowActivity : System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity, System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeFilterProvider

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

The InvokeWorkflowActivity first calls the Invoking code-beside method, if one is specified. Typically, this method is used to set up incoming parameters for the workflow instance to be invoked.

InvokeWorkflowActivity then creates and invokes a workflow instance of the specified type, passing the parameters that are provided. As soon as the workflow is invoked, the InvokeWorkflowActivity finishes immediately.

Properties

InstanceId

Gets the Guid that indicates the newly created workflow instance.

public Guid InstanceId { get; }
Value
Guid

The Guid that indicates the newly created workflow instance.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute

Remarks

Once the workflow is started the Guid of the created instance is assigned to the InstanceId property.

This property is a bindable property. The instance can be retrieved in the code-beside.

ParameterBindings

Gets the collection of parameters to bind to.

public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.WorkflowParameterBindingCollection ParameterBindings { get; }
Value
WorkflowParameterBindingCollection

A WorkflowParameterBindingCollection that contains the parameter bindings for the workflow being called. The default is an empty WorkflowParameterBindingCollection.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute

Remarks

The parameters in this collection are the parameters required to invoke the child workflow.

This collection can only specify inbound parameters. Outbound and reference parameters cannot be specified, because the workflow invocation is asynchronous.

TargetWorkflow

Gets or sets the Type of the workflow to be invoked.

public Type TargetWorkflow { get; set; }
Value
Type

The fully-qualified name of the workflow to be invoked. The default is null.

DefaultValueAttribute EditorAttribute
